characters: AT THE BACK OF THE ROOM --
WHO WANTS TO BE A MILLIONAIRE
AT THE TOP OF THE STAIRS --
AT THE BOTTOM OF THE STEPS --
THE VOICE OF AN ARMENIAN PRIEST
WE OPEN OUR EYES TO SEE --
THE SAME VIEW BY DAY, SUPERIMPOSED WITH --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing only underwear, a bathrobe and clogs, MILES RAYMO comes out of his unit and heads toward the street. He pas some SIX MEXICANS waiting to work. He climbs into his twelve-year-old CONVERTIBLE SAAB, park far from the curb and blocking part of the driveway. The starts fitfully. As he pulls away, the guys begin backing up the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles rounds the corner and finds a new parking spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cuts the engine, exhales a long breath and brings his  hands to his head in a gesture of headache pain or just  anguish. He leans back in his seat, closes his eyes, and  soon NODS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open. Miles runs into the kitchen, lookin just past camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!
THE MICROWAVE CLOCK that reads 10:50.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PHONE --
dialogues.text: Miles hurriedly throws clothes into a suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no, I know I said I'd be there  by noon, but there's been all this  work going on at my building, and  it's like a total nightmare, and I  had a bunch of stuff to deal with  this morning. But I'm on my way. I'm  out the door right this second. It's  going to be great. Yeah. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TOILET --
dialogues.text: Miles has a BOOK propped open on his knees. He turns a pa lost in his reading.

dialogues.speaker: LATER --
dialogues.text: Miles SHOWERS.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MIRROR --
dialogues.text: Miles FLOSSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles finally makes it to the front of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Simon. Triple espresso, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rough night, huh? (ringing it up) For here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm running late. Make it to go.  And give me a New York Times and... (scanning the display  case) ...a spinach croissant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles's Saab chugs up the ramp and merges.

dialogues.speaker: NEW YORK TIMES CROSSWORD PUZZLE --
dialogues.text: -- pressed against the STEERING WHEEL. The puzzle is abou 1/3 finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As though from an adjacent car, we see Miles driving whil carefully filling in an answer.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD --
dialogues.text: A SIGN reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN TO MILES as he signals to change lanes. The finished  puzzle lies on the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The houses on this block are blandly palatial as in so ma affluent Southern California suburbs. Miles's car pull into the driveway behind an older BMW an two LEXI. He gets out and trots toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: A GIANT PROJECTION TV --
dialogues.text: In a large split-level living room displays a GOLF TOURNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching from the ultra-comfortable furniture are MIKE  ERGANIAN, a tanned, silver-haired real estate caudillo; b to-be CHRISTINE ERGANIAN, his oldest daughter; and JACK  LOPATE, wearing bowling shirt, shorts and flip-flops. MRS. ERGANIAN, a warm and elegant housewife, shows Miles  into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what the cat dragged!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Erganian and Jack get to their feet and shake hands w Miles. Jack remains affable, but we can discern his genui irritation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About time you got here, bud. Mr.  Prompt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were thinking maybe you took the  wrong way and went to Tijuana and  they didn't let you back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Erganians laugh. Miles works up a smile too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to bribe them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More lame laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning in to kiss  Christine) Seriously though, the freeway was  unbelievable today. Unbelievable.  Bumper to bumper the whole way. People  getting an early start on the weekend,  I guess. Granted I got a late start,  but still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although Mr. Erganian presses MUTE on the remote, he keep watching for an extended moment, as do Jack and Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine, why don't you ask Miles  about the cake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good idea. Here, Miles, come to  the kitchen with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother him with that. We got  to get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking Miles's hand) It'll just take a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and the Erganians surround Miles as he eats from a p with two pieces of CAKE -- one white, one dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack tells us you are publishing a  book. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles shoots Jack a look. Mr. Erganian gets some ice cube from the refrigerator door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, it's not exactly finalized  yet, but, um, there has been some  interest and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jack) Your friend is modest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Miles, don't be so modest.  Indulge them. Don't make me out to  be a liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What subject is your book? Non- fiction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's a novel. Fiction. Although  there's a lot from my own life, so I  guess technically some of it is non- fiction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, I like non-fiction. There is  so much to know about the world that  I think reading a story someone just  invented is kind of a waste of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So which one do you like better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like them both, but if pressed I'd  have to say I prefer the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Christine) See?

dialogues.speaker: IN A REAR VIEW MIRROR --
dialogues.text: The Erganians wave good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR --
dialogues.text: Miles accelerates as he and Jack wave back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck were you, man? I was  dying in there. We were supposed to  be a hundred miles away by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help the traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. You're fucking hungover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, there was a tasting last night.  But I wanted to get us some stuff  for the ride up. Check out the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns around, and starts rooting around in a CARDBOA WINE BOX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you tell them my book was  being published?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you had it all lined up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I didn't. What I said was that  my agent had heard there was some  interest at Conundrum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Conundrum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and that one of the editors was  passing it up to a senior editor.  She was supposed to hear something  this week, but now it's next week,  and... It's always like this. It's  always a fucking waiting game. I've  been through it too many times  already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Senior editor? Sounds  like you're in to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long shot, all right? And  Conundrum is just a small specialty  press anyway. I'm not getting my  hopes up. I've stopped caring. That's  it. I've stopped caring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits back in his seat holding up a bottle of CHAMPAG and TWO GLASSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I know it's going to happen this  time. I can feel it. This is the  one. I'm proud of you, man. You're  the smartest guy I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack now begins to remove the foil from the champagne bot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't open that now. It's warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we're celebrating. I say we  pop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a 1992 Byron. It's really  rare. Don't open it now. I've been  saving it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack untwists the wire. Instantly the cork pops off, and fountain of champagne erupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christ's Sake, Jack! You just  wasted like half of it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack begins pouring two glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. (handing Miles a glass) Here's to a great week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming around) Yes. Absolutely. Despite your crass  behavior, I'm really glad we're  finally getting this time together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how long I've been begging  to take you on the wine tour. I was  beginning to think it was never going  to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clink and drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's tasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100% Pinot Noir. Single vineyard.  They don't even make it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinot Noir? How come it's white?  Doesn't noir mean dark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Don't ask questions like that  up in the wine country. They'll think  you're a moron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Color in the red wines comes from  the skins. This juice is free run,  so there's no skin contact in the  fermentation, ergo no color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not really listening) Sure is tasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab heads north.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys continue to drink and drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you read the latest draft, by  the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked it a lot. A lot of  improvements. It just seemed overall,  I don't know, tighter, more...  congealed or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the new ending? Did you  like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no new ending. Page 750 on  is exactly the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then I guess it must have felt  new because everything leading up to  it was so different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is pumping gas. Jack is stretching his legs nearby perhaps cleaning the windshield. A CELLPHONE RINGS. Jack reaches into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the phone) It's Christine. (snapping it open) Hey you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys having fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine's voice is so loud that Jack has to hold the ph away from his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. All twenty minutes so far have  been a blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silence, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just seeing how you're doing. And,  um, Mom and I were starting to look  over the seating charts again, and  we're wondering if you wanted Tony  Levin to sit next to the Feldmans,  or should he be at one of the singles  tables?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at Miles in a mute appeal for sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you think? With the  Feldmans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack hasn't even really heard the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. The Feldmans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the conversation continues, Miles replaces the GAS PUM screws the GAS CAP back on, and together the guys get bac into the car. We DRIVE AWAY WITH THEM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Because I don't know, I was  thinking that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then put him at the singles  table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem with that is that then  there's one extra --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then put him with the Feldmans.  Whatever you and your Mom decide is  fine with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't dismiss me. I'm trying to  include you in this decision. He's  your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't dismiss you. I told you  what I thought, but it didn't seem  to matter, so you decide. Besides,  this is supposed to be my time with  Miles. I hope you're not going to  call every five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to call every five  minutes, but this is important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I'm just saying you know I  need a little space before the  wedding. Isn't that the point of  this? Isn't that what we talked about  with Dr. Gertler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silence. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you being so defensive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Christine. Perhaps  it's because I feel attacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ask you one simple question, and  suddenly I'm attacking you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. I'll call you when we get  there, and we can talk about it then,  okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack SLAMS his cellphone shut, momentarily blinded with r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony Levin? Why did you fucking invite  Tony Levin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab heads north -- now passing through LOS ANGELES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles signals and begins to head for an EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, why are we getting off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just got to make one quick stop.  Won't take a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we could just say a quick  hello to my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother? Jesus, Miles, we were  supposed to be up there hours ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her birthday tomorrow. And I  don't feel right driving by her house  and not stopping in, okay? It'll  just take a second. She's right off  the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab takes an EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old's she going to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... seventy... something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab rounds a corner and parks in front of a modest C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching the front door, Miles pulls a BOUQUET OF FLOW out of a plastic grocery store bag. Jack carries a bottle CHAMPAGNE. Miles pulls a BIRTHDAY CARD out of the bag too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a PEN from his pocket and signs it. As he licks envelope, Jack rings the bell. Moments later PHYLLIS comes to the door. She is a matronl older woman in a nightgown and housecoat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise! Happy Birthday!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys offer up the flowers and champagne. Phyllis slur slightly as she speaks -- she's been doing some celebrati of her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. Miles. And Jack! What a  surprise. I can't remember the last  time you brought me flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're from both of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A famous actor bringing me flowers  on my birthday. Don't I feel special?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A famous actor who's getting married  next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's right. Isn't that nice? I  hope that girls knows how lucky she  is, marrying no less than Derek  Summersby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys follow her inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, Mrs. Raymond, that was eleven  years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you were wonderful on that  show. I never understood why they  had to give you that brain tumor so  soon. Why that didn't make you the  biggest movie star in the world is a  sin. It's a sin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you should be my agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was, I would sing your praises  up and down the street until they  put me in the loony bin. Now Miles,  why didn't you tell me you were coming  and bringing this handsome man? Look  how I'm dressed. I've got to run and  put my face on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look fabulous, Mrs. Raymond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over her shoulder) Oh, stop it. Make yourselves  comfortable. (now around the corner) You boys hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack gives Miles a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low) Just a snack. Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles leads Jack into this small condo. The TV is on, and it's MESSY. Amid the newspapers and junk mail and dishes, AB-ROLLER and an ancient SCHWINN EXER-CYCLE sit forgotten a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles finishes twisting ice trays into a MOP BUCKET as it fills with water in the sink. He puts the champagne in an carries it into the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a seat on the sofa next to Jack, who is watching

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you something. The secret  to opening champagne is that once  the cork is released, you keep  pressure on it so you don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concentrated on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a second. Guy's going for $2500.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles finishes opening the bottle with an elegant silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for my close up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys turn to see Phyllis now dolled up in thick make- and a PANTSUIT. Her eyebrows are painted and cock-eyed.  Overall she looks much worse than before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, champagne! Miles, why don't you  bring that out onto the lanai? I  thought we could eat on the lanai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Jack are seated in webbed chairs around a circu glass table. They are mid-meal. Everyone is more than a little lubricated, especially the birthday girl as she returns from the kitchen with anothe plate of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Raymond, this is delicious.  Absolutely delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting) They're just leftovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it chicken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have made something fancier  if a certain someone had let me know  that a certain someone was coming  for a visit with a certain special  friend. Could have made a pork roast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a surprise, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I could have already put clean  sheets on the other bed and the fold- out. You are staying. Wendy, Ron and  the twins are picking us up at 11:30  to go to brunch at the Sheraton.  They do a magnificent job there.  Wendy is so excited you're coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Jack freezes, his fork halfway to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talked to Wendy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just now. She's thrilled. And the  kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be chipper) Yeah, well. You know, Jack's pretty  eager to get up to... you know, but,  uh, yeah. We'll see how it goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you boys do what you want. I  just think it would be nice for us  to be together as a family on my  birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. (wiping his mouth) I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up and heads into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles heads toward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and goes directly to her dresser, opening a drawer fil with bras, panties and stockings. He burrows through his mother's lingerie until locating a CAN OF RAID. A can of Raid? He twists open the bottom and pulls it apart, revealing i to be a SECRET STASH for valuables disguised as a common  household product. Inside are stacks of ONE-HUNDRED DOLLA BILLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly peeling some  off) ...six, seven, eight,... (one more for good  luck) Nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His task complete, he closes the drawer, and as he stuffs the bills in his pocket, his glance falls upon FRAMED PHO atop the dresser -- -- A proud NINE-YEAR-OLD MILES poses in front of his chil San Diego home, showing off a WAGON filled with freshly  harvested lettuce. On the wagon is a hand-lettered sign - "10 cents a bunch." -- A Sears portrait shows the RAYMOND FAMILY: a much youn Phyllis, her husband, and their two children -- a 12-year old Miles and seven-year-old Wendy. -- Miles at his wedding. He and his bride VICTORIA look y and attractive, their faces radiant and hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles enters, flushes the toilet and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Miles slides open the door and takes his seat again, J is pouring Phyllis another glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what was that other one you did,  the one where you're the jogger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that was for, uh, wait... That  was for Spray and Wash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spray and Wash. That's the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I remember the girl who was in  it with me. She was something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just remember you jogging. So when's  the wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) This Saturday, Mom, remember? We  told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Miles is my best man, Mrs.  Raymond. My main man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (another drink of  wine) Miles, when are you going to get  married again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got divorced. Phyllis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years ago, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should get back together with  Victoria. She was good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Embarrassed for his friend, Jack just stares at his food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was good for you. (turning to Jack) And so beautiful and intelligent.  You knew her, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Real well. Still do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about you, Miles. Do you  need some money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles takes another drink of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDER BLACK, a CARD --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack. Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack finally awakens with a start and finds Miles standin above him, shaking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jack gets up, we see he has crashed on Phyllis's bed  adorned with all her decorative PILLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still in her pantsuit and smeared makeup, Phyllis lies  sprawled and snoring on the sofa. On the TV, ostensibly n turned off the night before, is an inane CARTOON. As Miles opens the front door, he spots Jack heading towa the TV to turn it off. Miles waves him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a loud whisper) She'll wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they leave and Miles closes the front door quietly beh him, we PAN to the flowers still wrapped and forgotten on side table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO PLATES OF FOOD float in front of two breasts tucked i a zippered uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disheveled and unshaven, Jack and Miles are served breakf by a young, innocently sexy WAITRESS. Jack leers after he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, man. Too early in the morning  for that, you know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a kid, Jack. I don't even look  at that stuff anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your problem, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if she'd even be attracted to  guys like us in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak for yourself. I get chicks  looking at me all the time. All ages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not worth it. You pay too big a  price. It's never free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They eat in silence a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get laid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles shrugs off the comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd be the best thing for you. You  know what? I'm going to get you laid  this week. That's going to be my  best man gift to you. I'm not going  to give you a pen knife or a gift  certificate or any of that other  horseshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather have a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. You've been officially  depressed for like two years now,  and you were always a negative guy  anyway, even in college. Now it's  worse -- you're wasting away. Teaching  English to fucking eighth-graders  when they should be reading what you  wrote. Your books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles concentrates on his eggs and hash browns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still seeing that shrink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went on Monday. But I spent most  of the time helping him with his  computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I say fuck therapy and what's  that stuff you take, Xanax?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Lexapro, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I say fuck that. You need to  get your joint worked on, that's  what you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack. This week is not about me.  It's about you. I'm going to show  you a good time. We're going to drink  a lot of good wine, play some golf,  eat some great food, enjoy the scenery  and send you off in style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And get your bone smooched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack spots the waitress coming out of the kitchen and mot for more coffee. She nods and smiles, indicating she'll b right over. Jack returns the smile and holds up a hand to signal he'll wait. Jack turns back to see Miles watching  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a series of shots, the Saab -- now with its TOP DOWN - makes its way onto the 101 and travels past landmarks tha those familiar with the Santa Barbara area might recogniz MUSIC accompanies this sequence that anchors us into the  rhythm of a road trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car now descends the Santa Ynez Mountains and heads t Buellton. Miles and Jack must SHOUT to be heard in the op car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? Let's take the Santa  Rosa turnoff and hit Sanford first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever's closest, man. I need a  glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys make top-notch Pinot and  Chardonnay. One of the best producers  in Santa Barbara county. (looking out the window) Look how beautiful this view is.  What a day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you hated Chardonnay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like all varietals. I just don't  generally like the way they manipulate  Chardonnay in California -- too much  oak and secondary malolactic  fermentation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab passes over the 101 and turns onto SANTA ROSA ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys now pass vineyards of immaculate grapevines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what a day! Isn't it gorgeous?  And the ocean's just right over that  ridge. See, the reason this region's  great for Pinot is that the cold air  off the Pacific flows in at night  through these transverse valleys and  cools down the berries. Pinot's a  very thin-skinned grape and doesn't  like heat or humidity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at Miles, admiring his friend's vast learning articulateness. The Saab now pulls of the road and makes its way down a l gravel DRIVEWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Miles. I really hope your novel  sells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jack. So do I. (noticing) Here we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles brings the car to a stop in the parking lot. As the get out and walk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what'd you guys finally decide on  for the menu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. Filet and salmon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but how are they making the  salmon? Poached with a yogurt-dill  sauce? Teriyaki? Curry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Salmon. Don't you always  have white wine with fish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus. Look, at some point we  have to find out because it's going  to make a big difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking out his phone) Let me call Christine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't have to be now. Let's go  taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe her a call anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles must curb his eagerness to go inside the tasting ro as Jack SPEED DIALS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, honey. So we're up here about  to taste some whites, and we need to  know how the caterers are going to  make the salmon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack listens, then grows suddenly impatient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I know, I didn't forget, but we  wound up at Miles's mom's house, and  it got really late, and it was hard  to call, so I'm calling you now. I  said I was sorry. Yes, I did. (to Miles) You heard me say I was sorry, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles just shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles heard me say I was sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jack gets more and more involved with the phone call, wanders off across the parking lot, progressively out of  earshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a break, will you? I just  called to find out about the salmon --  for our wedding -- to be more  involved, like you said -- and all  you want to do is get into it about  last night and, okay, I'm sorry. I'm  sorry I didn't call. You're totally  right. I know, but I'm trying to  make this the best wedding I can  with the best wine we can find. Don't  I get any credit for that? Okay.  Look, I've got to go. I'm out here  in the parking lot, and Miles is  waiting for me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so it goes, Jack's voice rising and falling. Miles de to head inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is at the bar, TWO GLASSES in front of him. Jack wa in and bellies up next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly) Baked with a butter-lime glaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS BURROUGHS, a POURER in a cowboy hat and ponytail, c over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the condemned man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he is. Jack, Chris. Chris, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Jack shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys want to start with the Vin  Gris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO GLASSES are filled with small amounts of PINOT NOIR V GRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is rose, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, yeah, it is a rose. Only this  one is rather atypically made from  100% Pinot Noir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinot noir? Not again! (joking, to Chris) You know, not all Pinots are noir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh. Miles swirls his glass in tight circles on the bar, then  lifts it to smell. Jack clumsily imitates Miles, perhaps  even spilling some wine in the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see details of what Miles now describes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First take your glass and examine  the wine against the light. You're  looking at color and clarity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What color is it supposed to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on the varietal. Just get a  sense of it. Thick? Thin? Watery?  Syrupy? Inky? Amber, whatever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now tip it. What you're doing here  is checking for color density as it  thins toward the rim. Tells you how  old it is, among other things, usually  more important with reds. This is a  very young wine, so it's going to  retain its color pretty solidly. Now  stick your nose in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack waves the glass under his nose as if it were a perfu bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be shy. Get your nose in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack now buries his nose in the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Wine? Fermented grapes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles smells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not much there yet, but you  can still find... (more sniffs) ...a little citrus... maybe some  strawberry... passion fruit... and  there's even a hint of like  asparagus... or like a nutty Edam  cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack smells again and begins to brighten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Maybe a little strawberry. Yeah,  strawberry. I'm not so sure about  the cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now set your glass down and get some  air into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles expertly swirls the wine. Jack follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oxygenating it opens it up, unlocks  the aroma and the flavors. Very  important. Now we smell again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do so. Jack smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you do with every one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do we get to drink it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack gulps his wine down in one shot. Miles chews his bef swallowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you rate this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usually they start you on the wines  with learning disabilities, but this  one's pretty damn good. (to Chris) This is the new one, right, Chris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Released it about two months ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Miles) You know, you could work in a wine  store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that would be a good move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Miles notices something about Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you chewing gum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab passes through this Danish-themed tourist town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab makes its way into this very average-looking Cen coast town right off the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab pulls into the parking lot of this motel. And lo there's the WINDMILL itself, its decorative blades motion

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Jack enter the room and throw their suitcases o their respective beds.

dialogues.speaker: LATER --
dialogues.text: The sounds of a SHOWER and OFF-KEY SINGING come from the  bathroom while Miles sits impatiently on the bed. He poun on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Jack, hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening the bedside drawer, Miles finds a GIDEON'S BIBLE tosses it in the trash -- apparently his hotel routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freshly showered and dressed for dinner, Miles and Jack a along the shoulder of this busy local two-lane highway. T pass a mall and a car dealership.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said it was close. Now  I'm all pitted out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not even a mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have driven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not with the wine list these people  have. We don't want to hold back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm making a mistake  marrying Christine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, do you think I'm doing the  right thing? Tell the truth. You've  been through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you waited for good reason,  and you proposed to Christine for  some good reason. So I think it's  great. It's time. You've got to have  your eyes open, that's all. I mean,  look at me. I thought Victoria and I  were set for life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine's dad -- he's been talking  about bringing me into his property  business. Showing me the ropes. And  that's something, considering how  long it took him to get over I'm not  Armenian. So I'm thinking about it.  But I don't know, might get a little  incestuous. But Mike does pretty  well. A lot of high-end commercial  stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're going to stop acting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. This would just provide some  stability is what I'm saying. I can  always squeeze in an audition or a  commercial here and there, you know,  keep myself in the game in case  something big comes along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not getting any younger, right?  And my career, well, it's gotten  pretty, you know, frustrating. Even  with my new manager. Maybe it's time  to settle down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's what feels right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (convincing himself) It does. Feels right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's a good thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding, feeling  better) Yeah. It's good. Feels good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles leads them away from the road and across a parking  lot. The camera PANS to reveal -- THE HITCHING POST, a local institution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Jack belly up. GARY, the Samoan bartender, spot Miles and extends a welcoming hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Miles. Long time no see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's that novel of yours coming  out?  We  all want to read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon, soon. Say, this is my buddy  Jack. He's getting married next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking Jack's hand) My condolences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you pouring tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lot of good stuff. (looking at a row of  bottles) Got the new Bien Nacido. Want a taste?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutement. (to Jack) They have their own label that's  just outstanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary pours Jack and Miles a generous sample and the two m swirl, sniff and taste. Jack is beginning to get the hang things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight as a nun's asshole but qood  concentration. Nice fruit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gary) Pour us a couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary fills their glasses and corks the bottle. Jack raise his glass to toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's to my last week of freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be great. Here's to  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clink their glasses and take a drink. We linger on t as Miles retreats inward and a restless Jack scans the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Miles review their menus. Jack looks up and spot PRETTY WAITRESS placing an order at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles. Check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles glances at the waitress and returns to his menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. That's Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I know Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that chick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, this is where I eat when I  come up here. It's practically my  office. And sometimes I have a drink  with the employees. Maya's great.  She's worked here about a year, maybe  a year and a half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is very hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And very nice. And very married.  Check out the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack leans forward and squints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't mean shit. When Christine  was a hostess at Sushi Roku, she  wore a big engagement ring to keep  guys from hitting on her. Think it  worked? Fuck no. How do you think I  met her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gal's married to I think a  Philosophy professor at UC Santa  Barbara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's a professor's wife doing  waitressing? Obviously that's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know anything about this  woman. Calm down. Let's just eat,  okay? (focusing on the menu) The duck is excellent and pairs nicely  with the Highliner Pinot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Maya comes by carrying a tray of food on her wa to another table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Miles. Good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing good, good. You look great.  Did you lose some weight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, actually. Busy night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, Sunday night. You guys been  out tasting today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it. This is my friend Jack.  Jack, Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile) Hiya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling back) Hi. Well, nice to see you guys here.  Bye, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, she's jammin'. And she likes  you. What else do you know about  her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she does know a lot about wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooooohh. Now we're getting  somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she likes Pinot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, she's a fucking waitress in  Buellton. How would that ever work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you always focus on the  negative? Didn't you see how friendly  she was to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She works for tips!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're blind, dude. Blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles focuses again on the menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also recommend the ostrich. Very  lean. Locally raised.

dialogues.speaker: TWO BURGUNDY GLASSES --
dialogues.text: are refilled with the contents of yet another bottle of  Hitching Post Pinot Noir. Jack and Miles are enjoying a post-prandial drink.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Looks like he's thinking about something. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate Tony Levin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack swirls his wine and downs it in one gulp. Just then

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Walks into the bar and takes a seat a few stools down. Sh has changed into a black cashmere sweater and corduroys,  lovely but tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gary) Highliner, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya looks over and smiles as Gary pours her a glass from their bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya gets an American Spirit Yellow out of her purse and  lights it while Gary pours her a glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to join us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (polite) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In no hurry, she takes a long sip of her wine, gets up an comes down the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how's that book of yours going,  Miles? I think you were almost done  with it last time we talked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finished it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting published. That's what  we're up here celebrating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles shoots Jack a look. Jack responds with a "don't-fuc it-up-brother" glower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fantastic. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She offers her glass, and all clink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jack) Are you a writer too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm an actor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? What kind of stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of TV. I was a regular on a  couple of series. And lately I've  been doing a lot of commercials.  National mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything I'd know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Recognize this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack takes a deep breath, and out comes a perfect VOICE-O VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Now with low, low 5.8% APR  financing."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya's mouth drops open and curves into a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's hilarious. You sound just  like one of those guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am one of those guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack launches into another one of his sure-fire hits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very fast) Consult your doctor before using  this product. Side effects may include  oily discharge, dizziness, hives,  loss of appetite, difficulty breathing  and low blood pressure. If you have  diabetes or a history of kidney  trouble... you're fucked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This makes Maya laugh a big throaty laugh. Jack joins in. Nervous about Jack's aggressive flirtatiousness, Miles mu a tight courtesy smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winding down) Oh. I needed that. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all take a drink of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you guys up to tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Jack has a chance to speak --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're pretty wiped. Probably go back  to the hotel and crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This makes Maya slightly embarrassed at her apparent  availability, but she recovers quickly, remains breezy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know what you mean. It's a  long drive up here. Where're you  staying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Windmill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Windmill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya downs the rest of her wine, stamps out her smoke, an picks up her jean jacket and purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, good to see you, Miles. Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she leaves --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll catch up with you later, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's gone. Jack gives Miles a slow burn look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll probably go back to the hotel  and crash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys walk drunkenly along the shoulder as CARS WHIZ B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl is looking to party, and  you tell her we're going to go back  to our motel room and crash? Jesus,  Miles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm tired. Aren't you tired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chick digs you. She lit up like  a pinball machine when she heard  your novel was getting published.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I've got another lie to live  down. Thanks, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to get you some action,  but you've got to help me out just a  little bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't seem to me like that's what  was going on. You were all over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody had to do the talking. And  by the way, I was right. She's not  married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No rock. When she came to the bar,  sans rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen is absolutely BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Single. Waitress. Getting off work.  Looking for love. A little slap and  tickle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She probably went home, lit some  candles, put on some relaxing music,  took a nice hot bath, and laid down  on her bed with her favorite vibrator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack begins to make a soft BUZZING noise, growing gradual louder and more rhythmic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you no shame?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh. Oh. Miles. Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's now a rustling noise and footsteps. Then a LIGHT flipped on in the BATHROOM. Miles closes the door behind him, and the only light visi is at the bottom of the bathroom door. Miles PEES -- a series of semi-forced SHORT SQUIRTS. Then FLUSH as a door opens and the light goes off. Jack starts BUZZING again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stops and Miles climbs into bed. Silence. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get your prostate checked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Jack are glancing at the menus. For some reason Jack is humorless and grumpy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what're we going to have? Pigs in  a blanket? The "rancher's special  breakfast"? Or maybe just some grease  and fat with a side of lard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not amused) So what's the plan today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We head north, begin the grape tour  up there, make our way south so the  more we drink the closer we get to  the motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sarcastically taps an index finger to his temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack exhales and looks away, as though he doesn't want to get into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sucks his teeth a moment searching for the right wor Then the dam bursts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am going to get my nut on this  trip, Miles. And you are not going  to fuck it up for me with all your  depression and anxiety and neg-head  downer shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh, now the cards are on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes they are. And I'm serious. Do  not fuck with me. I am going to get  laid before I settle down on Saturday.  Do you read me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, big guy. Whatever you say.  It's your party. I'm sorry I'm in  the way and dragging you down. Maybe  you'd have a better time on your  own. You take the car. I'll catch  the train back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, see, I want both of us to get  crazy. We should both be cutting  loose. I mean, this is our last  chance. This is our week! It should  be something we share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The older WAITRESS comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I take your order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am warning you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oatmeal, one poached egg, and rye  toast. Dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. And you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glaring at Miles) Pigs in a blanket. With extra syrup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab winds along this beautiful road that meanders th large open vineyards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAP and a MOVING LINE show the boys' route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAPES growing on the vine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Framed by foreground grapevines, the Saab passes in the  distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles has just downed a taste of red wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much skin and stem contact?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About four weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. That explains all the tannins.  And how long in oak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French or American?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, oak. That's a good wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as the pourer turns away toward other TASTERS, Jack  GRABS the bottle and helps himself and Miles to another g They slam back their drinks like tequila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles brings the Saab to a stop, and the guys get out. Be them lies an incredible view of endless vineyards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria and I used to like this  view. (lost in nostalgia) Once we had a picnic here and drank  a '95 Opus One. With smoked salmon  and artichokes, but we didn't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has the best palate of any woman  I've ever known. She could even  differentiate Italian wines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles, I gotta tell you something.  Victoria's coming to the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. You told me. I'm okay with  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but that's not the whole story.  She got remarried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She what? (long pause) When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About a month ago. Six weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To that guy? That guy with the  restaurant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack nods. Miles looks down at his shoes and draws a long breath. Then he stiffly gets back in the open car and clo the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles... MILES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles continues to stare straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) Jesus Christ, Miles. Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go home now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been divorced for two years  already. People move on. She has!  It's like you enjoy self-pity. Makes  you feel special or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she bringing him to the wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drop this bombshell on me. Why  didn't you tell me before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I knew you'd freak out and  probably get so depressed you wouldn't  even come on this trip. But then I  figured here would be the best place  to tell you. We're here to forget  about all that shit. We're here to  party!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (undeterred) I'm going to be a fucking pariah.  Everyone's just going to be holding  their breath to see if I'm going to  get drunk and make a scene. Plus  Tony fucking Levin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. It's cool. I talked to  Victoria. She's cool. Everyone's  cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified) You've all been talking about it?  Behind my back? Talking about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles turns and locates an open BOTTLE of wine in the bac seat. He uncorks it and begins to swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey. No, you don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack tries unsuccessfully to grab the bottle from Miles, Miles bolts out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pursued by Jack, Miles dashes down the hill, all the whil taking huge swigs from the bottle. OMIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles slows to walk between rows of GRAPEVINES. He polish off the bottle and tosses it. A painting Jack catches up  with him in the adjacent grapevine corridor. Miles's face crumbles as though he were about to cry. The he collapses to the ground and closes his eyes tight. Jack looks around impatiently for a moment. Then he squat down so he can see Miles underneath the vines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles ignores Jack and focuses on the beautiful RIPE GRAP that surround him. They seem to distract him from his pai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles looks up and shakes his head a definitive NO. Jack  can't help but LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun hangs low as the Saab pulls into the parking lot, Jack at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pourer, a brunette in her early thirties, breaks away from a BORING COUPLE down the bar. This is STEPHANIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. My friend and I are up  here doing the wine tour, and he  tells me that you folks make one  hell of a Syrah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what people say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slurring slightly) You gotta excuse him. Yesterday he  didn't know Pinot Noir from film  noir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a quick learner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie laughs. She apparently likes big good-natured l like Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to teach my friend here  some basics about wine over the next  few days before he goes off and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOMP! Under the bar Jack stomps on Miles's foot. Miles  winces. Stephanie slides TWO GLASSES in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right -- I'm here to learn. I  never had that much interest in wine  before, but this trip has been very  enlightening. Always like wine, of  course, but I don't know. More of a  beer man, really. Microbreweries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She THUMPS the cork off a bottle of Chardonnay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no better way to learn than  tasting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pours almost flirtatious amounts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now there's a girl who knows how to  pour. What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack swirls the wine as though he were by now a sommelier They look, they smell, they taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quaffable but far from transcendent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it. Tastes great. Oaky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie reaches for another bottle and pours. Jack's ey never leave her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cabernet Franc. (as they taste) This is only the fifth year we've  made this varietal. Very few wineries  around here do a straight Cabernet  Franc. It's from our vineyard up in  Santa Maria. And it was a Silver  Medal winner at Paso Robles last  year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've come to never expect  greatness from a Cab Franc, and this  one's no exception. Sort of a flabby,  overripe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) Tastes good to me. You live around  here, Stephanie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Santa Ynez. (low, to Miles) And I agree with you about Cab Franc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? We're just over in Buellton.  Windmill Inn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know a gal named Maya? Works at  the Hitching Post?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I know Maya. Real well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit. We just had a drink with  her last night. Miles knows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we move on to the Syrah, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she turns to reach for the right bottle, Jack winks at Miles. Miles shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our Estate Syrah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pours each of them a full HALF GLASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a bad, bad girl, Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I might need to be spanked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices the boring couple, visibly annoyed that she h been monopolized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she wanders down the bar, Jack turns to Miles, his mou wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bad girl, Miles. She might need to  be spanked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how often these pourers  get hit on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They glance down the bar at Stepanie. She smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is killing time by the car staring at his shoes. He looks over and sees Jack waddling over from the tasting r with TWO CASES OF WINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack puts the cases down and glances back at the building

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She called Maya, who's not working  tonight, so we're all going out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Maya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been divorced for a year now, bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack puts the wine in the trunk, and they get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie, holy shit. Chick had it  all going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she is cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute? She's a fucking hottie. And  you almost tell her I'm getting  married. What's the matter with you? (drumming on the  steering wheel) Gotta love it. Gotta love it.

dialogues.speaker: THE TV --
dialogues.text: GOLF on ESPN.

dialogues.speaker: MILES AND JACK
dialogues.text: sit transfixed, each on his own bed. The curtains are dra Then out of nowhere --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mocking) You know how often these pourers get  hit on? (getting up) I'm going for a swim. Get the blood  flowing. Want to come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. I want to watch this.

dialogues.speaker: THE TV --
dialogues.text: A guy gets ready to putt. The announcer whispers what an  important moment this is. The guy misses. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER BLACK --
dialogues.text: The sound of an AEROSOL CAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles. Hey, Miles. Time to get up.

dialogues.speaker: WE OPEN OUR EYES TO SEE --
dialogues.text: Jack spraying his feet with some Dr. Scholl's product.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles pulls himself out of bed and slouches toward his  suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking chick in the Jacuzzi -- goddamn, Miles, fucking going nuts  up here. Whole place is wide open.  Assylvania.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack does some actor's weird warm-up stretch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what should I wear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Casual but nice. They  think you're a writer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Miles begins to dig through his suitcase, Jack flips o his cellphone and speed-dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have any other shoes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles glances as his shoes sitting sadly on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Hello? Oh hey, baby, just checking  in. Not much. We're about to go out  for dinner, probably be out pretty  late, so I thought I'd say goodnight  now. I know, I love you too. I miss  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys get out of the car and walk along a timbered sid in this tourist town with wine tasting rooms and gourmet  restaurants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please just try to be your normal  humorous self, okay? Like who you  were before the tailspin. Do you  remember that guy? People love that  guy. And don't forget -- your novel  is coming out in the fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? How exciting. What's it  called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not sabotage me. If you want to  be a lightweight, that's your call.  But do not sabotage me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye-aye, captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if they want to drink Merlot,  we're drinking Merlot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dead serious) If anyone orders Merlot, I'm leaving.  I am not drinking any fucking Merlot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Relax, Miles, Jesus. No  Merlot. Did you bring your Xanax?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles takes a SMALL BOTTLE from his pocket and rattles it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't drink too much. I don't  want you going to the dark side or  passing out. Do you hear me? No going  to the dark side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles quickly POPS A XANAX. Jack gives him a final look i the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys enter this cozy if crowded restaurant and exchan words with the HOSTESS. Then they notice --

dialogues.speaker: MAYA AND STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: at a booth waving at them. They look great.

dialogues.speaker: MILES AND JACK
dialogues.text: make their way to the table, Jack wearing a broad, confid SMILE.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TABLE --
dialogues.text: Jack plops down next to Stephanie, while Miles politely e in on Maya's side. Jack touches a hand to Stephanie's bar neck and massages it meaningfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin' tonight, beautiful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. How're you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. You look great. (including Maya) You both do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so bad yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile Miles looks over at Maya and purses his lips in affable if uncomfortable smile. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you drinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Fiddlehead Sauvignon Blanc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? How is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sliding the glass) Try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Miles swirls the wine and takes a sip, he begins to re

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. Very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve months in oak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a Sauvignon Blanc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the winemaker. She comes in  the restaurant all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good. Little hints of clove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I love that.

dialogues.speaker: LATER --
dialogues.text: A WAITER finishes listing off the specials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...medallions of pork with a dusting  of black truffles served with a root  vegetable foulon and wasabi-whipped  potatoes. And finally a Copper River  salmon grilled on an alder wood plank.  And that comes with roasted new  potatoes and steamed watercress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four diners exchange looks of delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who gets the wine list?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles raises his hand and takes the leather-bound book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing) I guess Miles wants it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack glares at Miles, who immediately gets the hint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. You ladies choose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack smiles and nods his approval. Jack takes the book ou of Miles's hands and offers it to the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You choose, Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening it) So what does everyone feel like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you girls want. It's on us  tonight. Sky's the limit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're paying for the wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. We're celebrating  Miles's book deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, in that case...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles draws a long breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's everyone ordering? Then we  can sort out the wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactement!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack shoots Miles a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having the salmon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm having.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still scanning the  wines) I'm thinking about the duck breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slapping his menu  shut) Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that narrows things down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie lowers the menu so that only her eyes peer over the top. She looks at the others, and they look back at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like... Pinot Noir to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at Miles and raises one hand for a HIGH-FIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles reluctantly slaps Jack's hand. This causes the girl to laugh. MUSIC STARTS -- they're OFF! DINNER is improvised, but includes: -- The arrival of the FIRST WINE. -- The SALADS. -- Maya takes a turn with the wine list. Miles pushes her finger down into the prices with THREE DIGITS. -- New stemware is provided with the arrival of the SECON WINE. -- The four of them DRINK. Particularly Miles. -- Stephanie and Jack get cozier and cozier. -- The SALMON and DUCK arrive. -- Miles is too shy to look into Maya's eyes. She's inter and available -- it's too much for him. -- As Miles gets DRUNKER, the camera angles become sloppi the cutting choppier. -- Miles PONTIFICATES about some aspect of wine that Maya and Stephanie find interesting. Left out in the cold, his jaw tight, Jack wants to find a way in but can't. -- Miles reaches over to refill his glass, but Jack's arm shoots out to stop him -- "Slow down." CLOSE ON MILES as a distant RUMBLE begins to sound, the r of an oncoming ANXIETY ATTACK. By now he has drunk so muc that he spaces out, descending into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is boarding an OPEN BOAT atop this underground rive the River Styx. Just beyond a ghoulish HUMAN CARGO the ho boatman CHARON wields a long staff. Miles is crossing ove to the dark side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles returns to earth to find Jack and Stephanie now in  their own little world -- Jack explaining something to  Stephanie that she finds fascinating, just FASCINATING. -- Miles converses with Maya, but it's clear from her bem expression that he's being charming if not entirely coher -- ANOTHER WINE reaches the table -- a Comte Armand Pornr -- Miles looks over at Jack and Stephanie. They share a s but sensual kiss.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER --
dialogues.text: Miles is on his feet threading his way through the tables He is very unsteady, and we cut between first and third p perspectives.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BATHROOMS --
dialogues.text: He tries the MEN'S ROOM door but it's locked. He pulls th XANAX out his pocket and pops one in his mouth, swallowin it dry. He notices a PAYPHONE nearby. Thinking better of it for a moment, Miles makes a drunken bee-line for the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: THE KEYPAD --
dialogues.text: as many numbers are dialed, and we HEAR the TONES, comple out of sync, along with a sound melange of interior phone RINGING and a PICKUP.

dialogues.speaker: THE RECEIVER --
dialogues.text: As Miles presses it desperately to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles feigns an implausible upbeat tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria! How the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. What's, uh, what's on your  mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
