dialogues.text: Heard you got remarried!  Congratulations. Didn't think you  had the stomach for another go-round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Miles. You're drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some local Pinot, you know,  then a little Burgundy. That old  Cotes de Beaune!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles laughs at his own non-existent joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little place in Los Olivos. New  owners. Cozy ambiance. Excellent  food too -- you should try it. Thought  of you at the Hitching Post last  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles, don't call me when you're  drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted you to know I've decided  not to go to the wedding, so in case  you were dreading some uncomfortable,  you know, run-in or something, well,  worry no more. You won't see me there.  My wedding gift to you and what's- his-name. What is his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (silence, then --) Ken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles, I don't care if you come to  the wedding or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not coming, Barbie. So you  guys have fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to hang up now, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rushing to keep her  on) You see, Vicki, I just heard about  this today, you getting married that  is, and I was kind of taken aback.  Kind of hard to believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I just thought there was  still some hope for us somewhere  down the road and I just, I just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles, maybe it is better if you  don't come to the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles sucks something from between his two front teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Vicki. You're the  boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HANGS UP as nonchalantly as if it had been a sales cal and heads back to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a flash, Miles is walking an unstable, narrow ROPE BR extending vertiginously across a great CHASM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles reaches the table, tries to sit and SLIPS ONTO THE  FLOOR. Although at first Jack blinks heavily in disgust, the gir burst into hysterical LAUGHTER. Jack then laughs too, per OVER-LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, boy. Easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya helps him back into the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Just slipped. (picking up his glass) This is my blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles drinks. Stephanie makes a head gesture to Maya, who nods in return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the guys) Excuse us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to make you get up again, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Jack allow the girls to pass. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck, man? What is up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles reaches for his wine glass, but Jack moves it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull yourself together, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But in throwing open his arms for emphasis, he spills a W GLASS. Jack rights it and throws a napkin on the tableclo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you drink and dial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles's silence confirms his guilt and shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you always do this? Victoria's  gone, man. Gone. Poof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles looks down and squeezes his eyes tight while pushin out an exhale through his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it. You are blowing a great  opportunity here, Miles. Fucking  Maya, man. She's great. She's cool.  She's funny. She knows wine. What is  this morose come-down bullshit? These  girls want to party. And what was  that fucking ten-minute lecture on,  what was it, Vouvrays? I mean, come  on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say I'm uncomfortable  with the whole scenario.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles belligerently reaches for his Comte Armand. Jack le it pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't forget all the bad times  you had with Victoria. How small she  make you feel. That's why you had  the affair in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Shut your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see how Maya's looking at  you? You got her on the hook. Reel  her in! Come on, let's rachet this  up a notch. You know how to to do  it. Here. (passing a glass) Drink some agua.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles looks at the water, takes it and drains it. The girls now return to the table. The guys slide over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to appear  sober) Should we get dessert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were thinking. Why don't we go  back to my place? I've got wine,  some insane cheeses, music, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack raises both arms like a football referee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent idea. Waiter!

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD --
dialogues.text: Trees and bushes lit by the headlights show us we're head into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE --
dialogues.text: Jack drives. Miles blinks heavily as he tries to make a s of A HAND-DRAWN MAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing the map) Let me see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab pulls into a gravel DRIVEWAY and comes to a stop outside this wood-framed cottage. Jack and Miles get out and head for the front door. On th way, Jack reaches into his coat pocket and produces a str of FOUR CONDOMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearing) Here. One for you, three for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles wordlessly takes his. Just before they climb the po steps --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you want to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stops and looks at him for a moment with almost host incredulity. THE FRONT DOOR is open. Jack knocks twice on the SCREEN D before going in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys enter this modest living room furnished with  weathered but charming old furniture. Scattered here and  there are CHILDREN'S TOYS. FINGER-PAINTINGS are taped to walls. CANDLES are lit, and MUSIC is playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie sails in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple of wrong turns. (pointing a thumb at  Miles) Thanks to Magellan, here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a brief hug, Stephanie and Jack peck-kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. (to Miles) Maya's in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles hesitates a moment before Jack elbows him toward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles wanders in to find Maya squatting in front of a lit temperature-controlled WINE STORAGE UNIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got anything good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Steph's way into Pinots  and Syrahs. (calling out) Hey, Steph? You sure we can open  anything? Anything we want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything but the Jayer Richebourg!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has a Richebourg? Mon dieu. I  have completely underestimated  Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think you're dealing with  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya slips out a bottle of ESCHEVAUX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles nods vigorously. Maya looks back and forth between  Miles and the wine, her eyes narrowed. Then she slides it back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. I don't think we know each  other well enough. (picking out another  bottle) I'd say this guy's more our speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rise, and Miles glances at the ANDREW MURRAY SYRAH a raising his eyebrows, agrees. Maya begins opening it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what gems do you have in your  collection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much of a collection really. I  haven't had the wallet for that, so  I sort of live bottle to bottle. But  I've got a couple things I'm saving.  I guess the star would be a 1961  Cheval Blanc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a '61 Cheval Blanc that's  just sitting there? Go get it. (pushing him, playfully  stern) Right now. Hurry up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles laughs, fights back a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, the '61s are peaking,  aren't they? At least that's what  I've read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be too late already. What  are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Special occasion. With  the right person. It was supposed to  be for my tenth wedding anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understanding, Maya considers her response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The day you open a '61 Cheval Blanc,  that's the special occasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been into wine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I started to get serious about seven  years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the bottle that did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty-eight Sassicaia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles whistles and raises his eyebrows. Maya pours, and t clink their glasses together before savoring the wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. We gotta give it a moment, but  this is tasty. Really good. How about  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tastes again) I think they overdid it a bit. Too  much alcohol. Overwhelms the fruit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tasting again,  impressed) Yeah, I'd say you're right on the  money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Miles absently scans the REFRIGERATOR DOOR and spots PHOTO of Stephanie holding a LITTLE GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Stephanie's kid? Sure is  cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Siena's a sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she sleeping or...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's with her grandmother. She's  with Steph's mom. She spends a lot  of time over there. Steph's... well,  she's Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's voice-over voice from the other room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And now for a low, low 4.8% APR..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is followed by PEALS OF LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who me? Nah, I'd just fuck them up.  That was the one unpolluted part of  my divorce -- no kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, same here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya nods as she sips again, looking distant for a moment thinking about something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya takes the bottle, and they wander into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Stephanie are gone. From a distant bedroom comes more laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like our friends are hitting  it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Maya goes to turn down the STEREO, Miles sits on th couch. Maya's shirt rides up as she crouches, giving Mile glimpse of the small of HER BACK. She takes a seat opposite Miles on the couch. They look a each other without speaking. Just what is the vibe here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kind of weird sitting here with  you in Stephanie's house. All those  times you came into the restaurant.  It's like you're a real person now.  Almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. It's kind of weird.  Out of context.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, weird. But great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward silence, broken by Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your novel about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's a little difficult to  summarize. It begins as a first-person  account of a guy taking care of his  father after a stroke. Kind of based  on personal experience, but only  loosely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the title?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Day After Yesterday."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. You mean... today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... yeah but it's more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is it kind of about death and  mortality, or...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrnmm, yeah... but not really. It  shifts around a lot. Like you also  start to see everything from the  point of view of the father. And  some other stuff happens, some  parallel narrative, and then it  evolves -- or devolves -- into a  kind of a Robbe-Grillet mystery --  you know, with no real resolution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Anyway, I think it's amazing  you're getting it published. Really.  I know how hard it is. Just to write  it even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squeezing it out) Yeah. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like me, I have this stupid paper  due on Friday, and as usual I'm  freaked out about it. Just like in  high school. It never changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A paper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm working on a masters in  horticulture. Chipping away at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horticulture? Wow. I didn't know  there was a college here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I commute to San Luis Obispo twice a  week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... you want to work for a winery  or something someday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do have a copy of the manuscript  in the car. It's not fully proofed,  but if you're okay with a few typos...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Who cares? I'm the queen of  typos. (sipping the wine) Wow, this is really starting to open  up. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My palate's kind of shot, but from  what I can tell, I'd dub it pretty  damn good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a personal question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bracing himself) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you so into Pinot? It's like  a thing with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles laughs at first, then smiles wistfully at the quest He searches for the answer in his glass and begins slowly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's a hard grape to  grow. As you know. It's thin-skinned,  temperamental, ripens early. It's  not a survivor like Cabernet that  can grow anywhere and thrive even  when neglected. Pinot needs constant  care and attention and in fact can  only grow in specific little tucked- away corners of the world. And only  the most patient and nurturing growers  can do it really, can tap into Pinot's  most fragile, delicate qualities.  Only when someone has taken the time  to truly understand its potential  can Pinot be coaxed into its fullest  expression. And when that happens,  its flavors are the most haunting  and brilliant and subtle and thrilling  and ancient on the planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya has found this answer revealing and moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, Cabernets can be powerful  and exalting, but they seem prosaic  to me for some reason. By comparison.  How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Why are you into wine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I got really into wine  originally through my ex-husband. He  had a big, kind of show-off cellar.  But then I found out that I have a  really sharp palate, and the more I  drank, the more I liked what it made  me think about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what a fraud he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I do like to think about the  life of wine, how it's a living thing.  I like to think about what was going  on the year the grapes were growing,  how the sun was shining that summer  or if it rained... what the weather  was like. I think about all those  people who tended and picked the  grapes, and if it's an old wine, how  many of them must be dead by now. I  love how wine continues to evolve,  how every time I open a bottle it's  going to taste different than if I  had opened it on any other day.  Because a bottle of wine is actually  alive -- it's constantly evolving  and gaining complexity. That is,  until it peaks -- like your '61 --  and begins its steady, inevitable  decline. And it tastes so fucking  good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it is Miles's turn to be swept away. Maya's face tell us the moment is right, but Miles remains frozen. He need another sign, and Maya is bold enough to offer it: reache out and places one hand atop his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Bathroom over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles gets up and walks out. Maya sighs and gets and Amer Spirit out of her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom's a MESS -- the shower curtain is filthy, an the chipped and water-stained tub is filled with CHILDREN BATH TOYS. Miles is bent over the sink splashing water on his face,  trying to sober up and gather his courage. He stands, and without drying his face, presses his palms against his ch Then he takes a deep breath and drops his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are such a loser. Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles comes out of the bathroom and looks for Maya, but s not there. Then he hears a noise from the kitchen, so he goes throug the door into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya is at the sink, filling a glass with water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just getting some water. You  want some water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles goes to stand by her and accepts a glass of water.  Just as she's about to fill a second glass, he stops her looks her in the eye, trying to recapture a moment that i long gone. He kisses her and she kisses back, but the whole thing fe strained and awkward. After a few seconds, Maya breaks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But instead of resuming the kiss, she steps past him, hea back into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should probably get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles realizes he's blown it and silently berates himself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles drives down the hill behind Maya's car, which leads him through this very rural road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya's car comes to a stop just ahead of the Saab. She pu it in PARK and gets out.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SAAB --
dialogues.text: Miles rolls down his window as Maya leans over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how to get back to the  Windmill, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a good time tonight, Miles. I  really did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. So did I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. See you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... did you still want to read my  novel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Sure. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles turns to the backseat, locates a large MANUSCRIPT B and hands it to Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around again, produces a SECOND BOX, and hands i over as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope you like it. Feel free to stop  reading at any time. I'll take no  offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a friendly peck on the cheek. After she gets back in her car, she heads in one directio while Miles heads in the opposite. OMIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's cellphone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: NOW EARLY MORNING --
dialogues.text: Still fully clothed, Miles staggers across the room. Fishing the phone out of Jack's windbreaker pocket, he lo at the CALLER ID: "Erganian, Christine" and the number. H briefly considers his options -- answer it? shut it off? before placing it atop Jack's suitcase. The moment he lies back down on the bed, the MOTEL PHONE  RINGS. An old DIGITAL CLOCK next to it reads 7:l0. As Miles closes his eyes and pulls the pillow over his ac head, we again -- FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: LATER --
dialogues.text: VROOM! Outside a roaring MOTORCYCLE comes to a stop. Then over the sound of an IDLING ENGINE come familiar if indis VOICES and LAUGHTER. Miles opens his bleary eyes and listens. FOOTSTEPS pound on the balcony outside, and Jack lets him in, flushed and exuberant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking chick is unbelievable. Un-be- lieve-able!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pounds on the wall, then goes into the bathroom and wi closing the door unzips his pants to PEE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn, Miles, she is nasty. Nasty  nasty nasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm glad you got it out of  your system. Congratulations. Mission  accomplished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hungover Miles gets up and looks out the door Jack has  left open. Down in the parking lot he sees --

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: atop a mid-sized MOTORCYCLE, wearing a weathered fringed  suede jacket. She gives him a big friendly wave.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: returns the wave and goes back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't invite Stephanie to come  with us, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a FLUSH Jack emerges from the bathroom and opens his bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, change of plans. Steph's  off today, so she and I are going on  a hike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were supposed to play golf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go. In fact, use my clubs. They're  brand new -- gift from Christine's  dad. (slapping some cash  on the dresser) It's on me. Oh, say, by the way,  Stephanie and me were thinking we'd  all go to the Hitching Post tonight  and sit at one of Maya's tables, and  she'll bring us some great wines and  then we can all --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting down) Count me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh, I see. Didn't go so good last  night, huh? That's a shocker. You  mean getting drunk and calling  Victoria didn't put you in the mood?  You dumb fuck. Your divorce pain's  getting real old real fast, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles looks down. Jack heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, maybe you should check  your messages first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stops, eyeing Miles suspiciously. Miles tosses Jack phone. Jack flips it open and scrolls down with his thumb He doesn't like what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at the room  phone) She's been leaving messages here  too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SNAPS the phone shut and puts it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should call her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. (heading out the door) See ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack picks up his phone, sits on the bed and looks defian at Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got no problem calling her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Jack closes his eyes and brings the heel of his hand his forehead as he begins to concoct the BIG LIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening his phone) Wait outside, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles wanders out and looks down at Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fun last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Good food. You've got quite a  wine collection. Very impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Hey, I talked to Maya this  morning. She said she had a good  time too. You should call her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had to make a phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie cuts her bike's engine and climbs off, propping up on the kickstand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you up to today, Miles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kickin' back, I guess. I don't  know. Jack and I were supposed to go  golfing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I reserved the tee time about  a month ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You golf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? No, I think it's kind of a stupid  game. I mean, at least, I could never  get into it. I tried it once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Jack loves golf. Crazy about  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Jack cracks open the motel room door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed) Hey Miles. Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles ducks back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have that other condom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles reaches into his wallet and hands over the little f square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd Christine say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucked out -- got voice mail.  Everything's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack bounds out of the room and down the stairs like a ch on Christmas morning. Miles watches Jack climb on the bike behind Stephanie,  grasping her waist. Stephanie and Jack PEEL OUT, leaving Miles alone on the  balcony.

dialogues.speaker: MILES --
dialogues.text: As we begin to hear a SNIPPING sound which carries us to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles sits outside carefully trimming his toenails. SNIP, SNIP, SNIP. MUSIC BEGINS for this mournful montage of  solitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles takes a styrofoam cup and helps himself to a cup of complimentary COFFEE from a PUMP THERMOS. Then he takes a look at the rack of pamphlets of local TO ATTRACTIONS -- a water park, a mystery cave, and of cours winery after winery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid turbulent water, Miles corrects his students' papers He is alone in the tub, but at the nearby pool STOCKY KID play noisily with SUPER-SOAKERS.

dialogues.speaker: OVER MILES'S SHOULDER --
dialogues.text: The PAPER he's reading is marked up with circled spelling errors, and one entire paragraph has been crossed out. Fi a new error, Miles writes "NO!!!" CAMERA PANS to reveal a STACK of papers already heavily m with corrections, some of them mottled with water stains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles FLOSSES, his lips pulled back into a grotesque moue Then he brushes with a SONIC-CARE TOOTHBRUSH.

dialogues.speaker: LATER --
dialogues.text: Miles checks his machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No new messages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small Buellton eatery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only customer right now, Miles eats awkwardly with hi chopsticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles DRIVES ball after ball, unsuccessfully trying to re his frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab roars past us, perhaps going a little too fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistling absently as he drives, Miles leans over to turn the radio on and fiddle around to find a good station. Th all of a sudden -- WHUMP! The car has struck something with a hideous sound  followed immediately by the receding "ARF-ARF-ARF-ARF" of injured DOG in the Saab's wake. Miles applies the BRAKES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles gets out of his car just in time to see --

dialogues.speaker: A DOG
dialogues.text: scampering into the nearby woods. Miles looks around -- h anyone seen him? Is there a nearby residence? Finding not Miles momentarily weighs his options before finally GIVIN CHASE. He follows the path of the dog into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still hearing occasional distant barking, Miles finds his way among the trees and bushes, looking in vain for the i fated cur. After a frenetic search, Miles reluctantly gives up and h back. OMIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles has returned to where he hit the dog. Just then, Mi notices TWO MEXICAN CHILDREN watching him from just down road. They disappear into the bushes. Looking like a criminal, Miles trots back to the Saab cli behind the wheel and speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab pulls into the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles trudges up the stops to the room. He opens the door and sees --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: atop Stephanie, plowing her fertile fields. Despite the  interruption, their pace does not alter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now! Not now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles quickly shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles pours himself another glass of Pinot. Jack comes in and spots his morose friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, there you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you drinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack reaches over to check out the bottle's label. Miles  remains cool to Jack's amiability.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the bartender) Could I get a glass please? (to Miles) Stephanie took me out into the Pinot  fields today. It was awesome. I think  I finally got a handle on the whole  process, from the soil to the vine  to the -- what do you call it? --  selection and harvest. And the whole,  you know, big containers where they  mix it. We even ate Pinot grapes  right off the vine. (the new expert) Still a little sour but already  showing potential for great structure.  Stephanie really knows her shit,  Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack now has his glass and pours himself some wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Stephanie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs. Getting cleaned up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this chick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she know about Saturday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... not exactly. But I've been  honest. I haven't told her I'm  available. And she knows this trip  up here is only for a few days.  Besides...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stops short in a rare instance of self-censorship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I don't know, just... the  wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've been doing some thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you've been thinking. And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may have to put the wedding on  hold is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles looks at him with incredulity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fully realize that making a change  like that might be tricky for certain  people to accept at first, but life  is short, Miles. I've got to be sure  I'm doing the right thing before  taking such a big step. And not just  for my sake. I'm thinking about  Christine's feelings too. I take  marriage very seriously -- always  have. That's why I've never done it  before. The day I get married, it's  going to be the real thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles just looks at his friend, waiting for more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being with Stephanie has opened my  eyes. She's not uptight or  controlling. She's just cool. Things  are so easy with her. Smells  different. Tastes different. Fucks  different. Fucks like an animal. I'm  telling you, I went deep last night,  Miles. Deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles draws a long sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get all judgmental on me. This  is my deal. It's my life, and it's  my call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fall silent for a moment. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping to get some understanding  from you. And I'm not getting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understanding of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I might be in love with another  woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In love? Twenty-four hours with some  wine-pourer chick and you think you're  in love? And give up everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who's talking. You've been there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I have, and do I look like a  happy man? Was all that drama with  Brenda a happy thing for me to do?  Huh? Was it? Is she a part of my  life now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is totally different. I'm talking  about avoiding what you're talking  about. That's the distinction. I  have not made the commitment yet. I  am not married. I have not said the  words. In a few days, I might get  married, and if I do, then I won't  be doing stuff like this anymore.  Otherwise, what's the whole point of  getting married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about Stephanie? She's a  woman -- with a kid. A single mom.  What do you think she's looking for?  Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Here's what I'm thinking. We move up  here, you and me, buy a vineyard.  You design your own wine; I'll handle  the business side. Then you get  inspired and write a new novel. As  for me, if an audition comes along,  hell, LA'S two hours away. Not even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy. You've gone crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you care anyway? You don't  even like Christine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Of course I like Christine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said she was shallow. Yeah, and  a nouveau riche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was three years ago after that  first party!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Miles, all I know is I'm an  actor. All I have is my instinct. (his hand on his chest) My intuition -- that's all I have.  And you're asking me to go against  it. And that's just wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Stephanie walks in. She cozies up to Jack, and kisses the top of her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, guys. We should probably get  going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: A VIDEO GAME MONITOR
dialogues.text: as a crazy car races through the obstacle-ridden track, o leaving the road, much like Jack's libido.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to reveal six-year-old SIENA seated in Jack's lap as they drive together. A delighted Siena laughs and giggles. Miles sits nearby with Stephanie and her fifty-something, two-pack-a-day MOTHER CARYL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie's heard this a thousand  times, but if I'd done what I wanted  and I'd bought up in Santa Maria  when I had the chance, I would have  made a fortune when they put in that  outlet center and that Home Depot. (a drag off her  cigarette, then to  Stephanie) Your father knew it too, but he was  a fucking chickenshit. Always was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caryl looks over her shoulder, her gaze drawn to Jack and Siena, so completely happy together. Caryl exhales a puff of smoke as she watches. Stephanie i equally enthralled. Miles takes it all in, trying his bes not to shake his head in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caryl is behind the wheel of her OLDSMOBILE as Stephanie  gets Siena buckled up in the backseat. Jack pulls Miles a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm going to make sure Steph  and Siena get home safe, and then  maybe we'll hook up with you later,  okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dispirited) Sure, whatever. Maybe I'll catch a  movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie kisses Miles's cheek before getting in the car  next to her mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you, Miles. You take care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Stephanie. Bye, Siena, Caryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he gets in the car --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me on my cell if you go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles watches them drive away, then heads toward his Saab

dialogues.speaker: THE COUNTER --
dialogues.text: as Miles places a box of security ENVELOPES, a packet of  BEEF JERKY and some TROPICAL FRUIT SKITTLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles points over the CASHIER'S SHOULDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And could I get a Barely Leqal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cashier reaches for the magazine --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO, um, the new one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is once again FLOSSING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POP! Miles opens a bottle of Pinot and pours himself a gl He carries it to bed, takes a nice big slug, lies down on the bed and opens his magazine.

dialogues.speaker: NOW SNEEZING ATOP THE BED
dialogues.text: The Barely Legal face down on his chest, Miles awakens wi a start and looks at the clock-radio. He thinks a moment, takes a deep breath, and bounds off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: A WATER-SAVER SHOWER HEAD --
dialogues.text: as little needles of water come at us.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE BATHROOM DOOR --
dialogues.text: Miles takes a nice hot SHOWER. But wait -- he has forgott to put the shower curtain inside the tub. A closer look  reveals a growing PUDDLE OF WATER on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles walks across the parking lot. He pauses before ente then forces himself to take the leap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles affects nonchalance as he searches briefly for Maya He continues on into the BAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it hanging, Miles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me. I love it up here. How  about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy night for a Tuesday. We had a  busload of retired folks in on a  wine tour. Usually they're not too  rowdy, but tonight there was something  going on. Full moon or something.  What can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Highliner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass or bottle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers, then --) Bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, is Maya working?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya? Haven't seen her. I think she's  off tonight. Say, where's your buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary serves Miles, alone at the bar. Miles takes his firs drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's tasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's closing time. The front door flies open, and Miles  staggers out sideways. Gary follows him out, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, Miles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles heads in the wrong direction at first, then realize his mistake and steers himself back toward the Windmill. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open, and Jack comes bounding in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, dude. Let's go golfing! I  got us in at Alisal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles comes to, very hungover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a public course. (then --) No Stephanie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's working. I need a break anyway.  She's getting a little clingy. (magnanimous) This is our day!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: WHACK! Jack TEES OFF with a manly athletic swing and shad his eyes to watch the ball's trajectory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles, disheveled and sullen, approaches the teebox, stic a tee in the ground and sets his ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever got ahold of Maya  yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She likes you, man. Stephanie'll  tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (preparing to swing) Can you give me some room here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping back) Oh yeah. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles lifts his club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, in life you gotta strike  when the iron's hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles refocuses and SWINGS just as Jack offers more helpf advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't whiff it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK! Despite the distraction, Miles manages to make a g long drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: NOW ON THE FAIRWAY --
dialogues.text: Jack is pouring two Dixie cups of wine as Miles prepares take his next swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your agent? Hear anything  yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been checking your messages?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obsessively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They probably think my book is such  a piece of shit that it's not even  worthy of a response. I guess I'll  just have to learn how to kiss off  three years of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't know yet, so your  negativity's a bit premature, wouldn't  you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or fuck those New York publishers.  Publish it yourself. I'll chip in.  Just get it out there, get it  reviewed, get it in libraries. Let  the public decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giving Jack a look that says Jack has no idea what he's  talking about, Miles takes a stance over the ball and foc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come over the top. Stay still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just trying to be helpful. (a moment later) It's all about stillness, Miles.  Inner quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles drops his club and turns to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Shut up! Shut up! What's  the matter with you, man? SHUT UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you so hostile? I know you're  frustrated with your life right now,  but you can choose not to be so  hostile. (holding out a cup of  wine) Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still fuming, Miles begrudgingly accepts the wine and has taste. He's immediately distracted from his woes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Got it from Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles downs the rest and is intrigued by the taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Let me see the label.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a golfball THUDS against the hard fairway direct behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whirling around) What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way back on the tee box, some 200 yards away, are a FOURS of two couples. One of the MEN is waving his driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting, barely  audible) Hurry it up, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at Miles, the two incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucker hit into us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) Hey, asshole! That's not cool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw me his ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks over, picks up the offending ball and tosses i to Miles. Miles gets out his 3-wood and -- THWOCK! -- cut it back low and hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice shot.

dialogues.speaker: THE COUPLES
dialogues.text: duck for cover as the ball whistles over their heads.

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND MILES
dialogues.text: laugh hard.

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO HUSBANDS
dialogues.text: climb in their CART and hasten down the fairway toward Ja and Miles.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: watches their approach, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is going to be fun. (jerking a driver  from his bag) This is going to be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack heads in their direction, brandishing the club like medieval knight with a mace. As the husbands get a look at this sight, they turn their cart around and speed back toward their wives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit into us again, motherfuckers,  and I'll ass-rape all four of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Miles are turning in their cart and hoisting the clubs over their shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't give up on Maya. Cool  smart chicks like that --they like  persistence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is she's beautiful. Lots  of soul. Perfect for you. I'm not  going to feel good about this trip  until you guys hook up. Don't you  just want to feel that cozy little  box grip down on your Johnson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby a GOLFER is with his YOUNG SON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you mind keeping it down, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Jack walk toward their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it the money thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is what the money thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah, that's part of it. Woman  finds out how I live, that I'm not a  published author, that I'm a liar  essentially, then yeah, any interest  is gonna evaporate real quick. If  you don't have money at my age, you're  not even in the game. You're just a  pasture animal waiting for the  abattoir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is an abattoir like a... like a...  what is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slaughterhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abattoir. Huh. But you are going to  get the good news this week about  your book. I know you are. I can  feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's CELLPHONE rings, and he checks the caller ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Steph. (picking up) Hey, baby. Yeah. Oh yeah. Yesssss. I  mean I would, but let me see. Hey,  Miles... Oh fuck it, we're going.  We'll be right there. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snaps his phone shut and turns to Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to have some fun. Remember  fun? We're going to have some of it.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to tell me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I SAID OKAY?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles finally smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab pulls up where Stephanie and Maya await with bot of wine and a PICNIC BASKET. The girls climb into the bac seat, and the car speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going FAST, hair whipping around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Miles, I heard you came by the  restaurant last night looking for  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. No. I mean yeah, I stopped  by for a drink. Didn't see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, nice to see you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH! That car's going a little too FAST!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two couples wander around this historic site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls have led them to a beautiful spot.

dialogues.speaker: IN A SERIES OF SHOTS --
dialogues.text: we see the progress of their picnic. We don't hear them, there is a growing intimacy about their interaction. Even Maya and Miles seem to be overcoming residual awkwardness from the other night. Jack and Stephanie lean on each oth as they eat and sip wine. Finally, the two couples are SILHOUETTED against the SUNS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parking lot is crowded. The foursome join others head toward the main building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LECTURE by British wine sage LESLIE BROUGH is in progre He holds aloft a RIEDEL BURGUNDY GLASS containing one of few but growing number of local reds worthy of his attent

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AUDIENCE --
dialogues.text: As our foursome listen attentively, Jack leans over to Mi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever actually read any of this  guy's books?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wrote a great one on Burgundy,  and I used to get his newsletter,  but then there were doubts about  whether he does all his own tasting.  Plus a couple of times he declared  certain years vintages of the century,  and they turned out to be turkeys.  Fucker never retracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie leans forward and signals to Maya with a YAWN o GAGGING FINGER IN MOUTH that they hightail it. Although M protests at first, they stand and leave.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BACK OF THE ROOM --
dialogues.text: Stephanie finds a DOOR which she tests to see whether it open. It is! She leads her pals furtively inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an enormous, dimly-lit chamber filled with stainl steel FERMENTATION TANKS and stacks of OAK BARRELS. As the two couples walk in the near-darkness, they are  entranced. Maya takes Miles's hand and leads him away.

dialogues.speaker: LATER --
dialogues.text: In the background, Stephanie and Jack lean against a tank kissing. CAMERA DOLLIES to reveal Miles and Maya among the barrels the foreground. They are shy with each other, on the verg of kissing but holding back. THE MUSIC CONTINUES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE BOTTLES OF WINE sit empty on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four friends sit on the floor around the coffee table They drink wine and pass a JOINT. Suddenly they explode i LAUGHTER. A sleepy Siena appears at the hallway door rubbing her ey Stephanie gets up, but Jack stops her, gathers Siena in h arms, and takes her back to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab pulls away from the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles sits in his own passenger seat as Maya tries her ha at the Saab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya leads Miles up her back stairway. They're both a lit woozy from the hours of drinking.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOOR --
dialogues.text: Maya searches through her purse for her keys while Miles  hovers directly behind her, staring at her ear. Her ear? Just as Maya puts the key in the lock, he impulsively lea forward to kiss the nape of her neck. Maya's reaction is  immediate -- she turns to embrace Miles, giving him a lon KISS. Then she opens the door, pulls him inside and close the door in our face. The camera PANS to the nearby ROOFTOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PANS back to Maya's door, tilting down to find blue-wrapped NEW YORK TIMES. The door opens, and Maya's h picks up the newspaper. The CAMERA FOLLOWS Maya inside to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a small, clean apartment furnished with simple tast Maya is dressed in a ROBE and holds a COFFEE MUG. She dro the paper on the dining table and continues into --

dialogues.speaker: THE BEDROOM --
dialogues.text: where Miles lies on his stomach DEAD TO THE WORLD. His st face is squished against the mattress and he SNORES light Maya looks at him for a moment before shaking his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a weekly event in a big PARKING LOT -- organic  produce, candles and incense, honey and cider. Maya and Miles are shopping. Miles carries the bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across from each other at a PICNIC TABLE, and surrounded the remnants of BREAKFAST, Miles and Maya read the NEWSPA Miles is doing the CROSSWORD PUZZLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys should stop by the restaurant  for lunch today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. What's the latest we can get  there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About two-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing) Did you hear about this Bordeaux  tasting dinner down in Santa Barbara  Saturday night? It's a little pricey,  but if you wanted to go, I'd be into  it. Why don't you stay through the  weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles has just figured out a difficult clue. As he writes down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we've got to get back Friday for  the rehearsal dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What rehearsal dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles stops writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's getting married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya leads the way toward the Saab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you ever going to say anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I was. I mean, just now I  could have made up some story, but I  didn't. I told you the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya turns to confront Miles with a look of "Give me a br Miles reaches out to touch her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jerking away) Don't touch me. Just take me home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles drives, glancing occasionally at Maya, who stares  straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've told him. I've told him over  and over, but he's out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what he's been saying to  her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an actor, so it can't be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, just that he loves her. That  she's the only woman who has ever  really rocked his world. How he adores  Siena. How he wants to move up here  and get a place with the two of them  and commute when he has to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he believed every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stony silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please believe me. I was even on the  verge of telling you last night,  but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you wanted to fuck me first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Maya. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles brings the car to a stop. Maya opens the door and b to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I just spent three years  trying to extricate myself from a  relationship that turned out to be  full of deception. And I've been  doing just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I haven't been with anyone since  my divorce. This has been a big deal  for me, Maya -- hanging out with  you, and last night. I really like  you, Maya. And I'm not Jack. I'm  just his... his freshman roommate  from San Diego State.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya wants to let Miles's words reach her, but she can't  just yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I have my paper, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unsure what she wants at first, Miles reaches into the ba seat for the New York Times. He hands it to her and watch until she goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles pulls up and parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Miles enters, a shirtless Jack drops the Barely Legal is immediately upon him, grabbing him in a big BEARHUG. T TV is on, perhaps showing an E! True Hollywood Story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo! Yo! Here's my boy! Here's my  boy! Who's your daddy, boy? Who is  yo' daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put me down, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack continues his paean to Miles's triumphant night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said put me down. Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still gripping Miles in a bearhug, Jack flings the both o them onto the bed. Now on top of Miles, Jack KISSES both  cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so proud of you! Let me love  you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now they get up off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me everything. Details. I  like details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding, right? Tell me what  happened, you fucker, or I'll tie  your dick in a knot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's leave it alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at Miles, his face frozen with incomprehension

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't get any, did you? (off Miles's silence) You're a homo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stop, okay? Make something up,  and that's what happened. Whatever  you want. Write my confession, and  I'll sign it. Just stop pushing me  all the time! I can't take it! You're  an infant! This is all a big party  for you, but not for me! This is  serious. And you -- Just... leave me  alone, okay? You're fucking me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Okay. Calm down. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles begins to calm down. Jack grows concerned and  sensitively puts one arm around his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have trouble performing?  Yeah, that's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Shut up, Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS and both men look at it, silenced by the  ominous sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jack is drawn to it as though enticed by a strange ga of Russian roulette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack picks up the receiver and puts it to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Oh, hey, honey. How you doing?  Uh-huh. Uh-huh. (mouthing) Christine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles lies on his bed and clamps both hands over his ears His face is dark with resentment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, honey. Let me call you back.  Miles and I are in the middle of  something. No, it's nothing serious --  Miles is just having one of his freak- outs. Yeah. Love you too. I'll call  you right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole week has gone sour. It  isn't turning out like it was supposed  to. (deadly serious) I want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's being selfish now? I'm the one  getting married. I thought this week  was supposed to be about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta slow down. (closing his eyes) I'm so tired. Let's just get out of  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack watches Miles be fitted for SNEAKERS. A SALES ASSOCI ties Miles's laces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles gets up and walks in a circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they're great. Sporty. They're  really sporty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they too sporty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys exit Sears, Miles wearing his new shoes and carr a PLASTIC BAG with a string handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing something) Oh here, wait a second. I want to  run in here real quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads toward a TOYS STORE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder) I want to get something for Siena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mildly concerned, Miles watches Jack go into the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is slumped in the passenger seat as Jack drives. Th pass a BIG COMMERCIAL WINERY. Jack slows down, preparing turn in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about this one? We didn't hit  this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's Frass Canyon. It's a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever actually been in there,  Miles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning the wheel) I say we check it out. You never  know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab finds a place in the large parking lot. A TOUR B whose flank reads "Solvang Wine Tours," is in the process letting out WINE TOURISTS, many of them elderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room boasts not only a large TASTING BAR but also dis after display of t-shirts, golf shirts, olive oils, choco sauces and other gourmet tourist items emblazoned with th winery's logo. In the corner an ACOUSTIC GUITARIST with a small amp play soothing Windham Hill-ish music. The tasting bar is packed three-deep with TASTERS attende to by HARRIED POURERS. Finally the POURER gets to their glasses. Miles chews a s and swallows, then downs the rest in a single gulp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tastes like the back of a fucking LA  schoolbus. Probably didn't de-stem,  hoping for some semblance of  concentration, crushed it up with  leaves and mice, wound up with this  rancid tar and turpentine mouthwash  bullshit. Fucking Raid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Tastes okay to me. (looking at the tasting  sheet) Hey, they got a reserve pinot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me use your phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing it over) What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take it anymore. I've got to  call Evelyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking across the lawn outside, Miles holds the cellphon to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn Berman-Silverman's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, it's Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi, Miles. Let me see if I can  get her. (a moment later) You're in luck. I'll put you through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Evelyn, it's your favorite  client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the trip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, good. Drinking some good wines  and kicking back, you know. So what's  happening? Still no word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually there is word. I spoke to  Keith Kurtzman this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... they're passing. Conundrum's  passing. He said they really liked  it. They really wanted to do it, but  they just couldn't figure out how to  market it. He said it was a tough  call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Miles. (off his silence) So I don't know where that leaves  us. I'm not sure how much more mileage  I can get out of continuing to submit  it. I think it's one of those  unfortunate cases in the business  right now -- a fabulous book with no  home. The whole industry's gotten  gutless. It's not about the quality  of the books. It's about the  marketing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is at a loss for words. A distant RUMBLE begins to  sound, the familiar harbinger of an anxiety attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again we see the narrow ROPE BRIDGE extending  vertiginously across a great CHASM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you there? Miles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Miles. We did all we could.  You've been a real trooper. (loudly, to her  assistant) Tell him I'll call back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a wonderful writer, Miles.  Don't be discouraged.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER --
dialogues.text: Miles STAGGERS toward the tasting room, unpocketing his X and downing a couple, as Evelyn's clichГ©s of consolation continue in his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hang in there, and who knows?  After you get something else  published, we can revisit this one.  And next time we can try a different  title.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once back at the tent, he leans against it in a vain atte to steady himself. The RUMBLE grows deafening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now inside, Miles grabs the first DIRTY WINE GLASS he fin and shakes it out as he approaches the closest tasting  station. He pushes his way to front. The pourer offers the usual one-ounce dollop. Miles jacks back, immediately extending his glass for more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same small amount is poured and downed. Once again Mi holds out his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pour me a full glass. I'll pay for  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a tasting, sir. Not a bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles slams a TWENTY-DOLLAR BILL on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me a full goddamn pour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pourer turns away to serve another party. Miles looks around indignantly, as though everyone should be sympathe to this injustice. Now Miles boldly reaches over and pours himself a glass r up to the brim and beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I need a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then buy a bottle and go outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pourer grabs Miles by the wrist before he can drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the glass down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the ensuing struggle, the wine spills, and everyone ne steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to leave, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pourer signals to a SECURITY GUY at the door. Across room Jack notices the disturbance and heads over. Miles hoists up the SPIT BUCKET, holds it aloft and start to GUZZLE it. Wine cascades down the sides of his face, o his shirt and even onto his shiny new shoes. The Security Guy yanks the bucket away from Miles, and dr him toward the EXIT. Jack catches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the horrified  onlookers) It's all right. His mother just died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two PELICANS soar low over the water. One of the DIVES,  crashing into the water and disappearing from view. Jack and Miles sit on the hood of the Saab, gazing at the ocean, sharing a bottle of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just write another one. You have  lots of ideas, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm finished. I'm not a writer.  I'm a middle-school English teacher.  I'm going to spend the rest of my  life grading essays and reading the  works of others. It's okay. I like  books. The world doesn't give a shit  what I have to say. I'm unnecessary. (a dark laugh) I'm so insignificant, I can't even  kill myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know -- Hemingway, Sexton, Woolf,  Plath, Delmore Schwartz. You can't  kill yourself before you've even  been published.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that guy who wrote  Confederacy of Dunces? He committed  suicide before he got published, and  look how famous he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give up. You're going to make  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half my life is over, and I have  nothing to show for it. I'm a  thumbprint on the window of a  skyscraper. I'm a smudge of excrement  on a tissue surging out to sea with  a million tons of raw sewage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? Right there. Just what you just  said. That's beautiful. A thumbprint  on a skyscraper. I couldn't write  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither could I. I think it's  Bukowski.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unable to respond, Jack looks up and down the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOOM! There goes the Saab. The CAMERA lingers behind and PANS to reveal THE DEAD DOG now covered with FLIES AND MAGGOTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Miles pull into the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lighting up) Oh, look. There's Steph!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles broadly and honks his horn. Miles turns to see

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: seated halfway up on the motel stairs, her HELMET in her  lap, watching patiently as --

dialogues.speaker: THE SAAB
dialogues.text: pulls to a stop in a parking space. Miles masks his concern as he gets out of the car and rea in the backseat for his Sears bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Hey, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie stands up and slowly descends the steps, as Jac reaches into the trunk and pulls out a BIG CUDDLY LION DO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what I got for our favorite  girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie walks toward Jack as he waddles toward her hugg the lion. When they get close, Stephanie's face transform with rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU MOTHERFUCKER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swings her helmet and HITS JACK FULL IN THE FACE. Jack falls, blood spraying out of his nose. Stephanie sta over him and continues to BEAT HIM with her helmet as he  rolls back and forth, protecting his head with the stuffe lion. Miles ineffectually attempts to stop her, dancing just ou of range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking bastard! Lying piece of  shit! You're getting married on  Saturday? What was all that shit you  said to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you loved me! You fuck! I  hope you die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that she backs away. Glancing at her bloodied helmet she tosses it onto the pavement before getting on her bik

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckface! (to Miles) You too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she speeds away, Miles is left to comfort his wounded  friend. The lion lies nearby, staring blankly at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated in the passenger seat and in great agony, Jack pre a BLOOD-SOAKED TOWEL against his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you glad you didn't move up  here and marry her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't need a lecture. You fucking  told Maya, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I did not. Must have been Gary  at the Hitching Post. I think we  mentioned it to him the first night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told him. I'm fucking hurting  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it elevated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A COSMOPOLITAN open to an article titled "24 Way To Please Your Man."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles reads, while nearby a YOUNG BOY dry-heaves into a  garbage can held by his FATHER. An OLD WOMAN parked in a  wheelchair faces the wall.

dialogues.speaker: LATER --
dialogues.text: Miles is at a PAYPHONE. As he speaks he tries to peel off the metal LONG DISTANCE STICKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. It's Maya. Please leave a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Miles. Listen, I don't know if  you even care, but I had to call and  tell you again how much I enjoyed  our time together and how sorry I am  things turned out the way they did.  I think you're great, Maya -- always  have. From the first time you waited  on me. (bracing himself) And while I'm at it, I guess you  should know that my book is not  getting published.
