I thought this  one had a chance, but I was wrong.  Again. Don't bother reading it --  you've got better things to do. So  you see I'm not much of a writer.  I'm not anything really. The only  real talent I seem to have is for  disappointing people and now you  know that firsthand. We're leaving  in the morning, and I want you to  know that I take with me wonderful  memories of you. I'm sorry. I'm really  sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else to say? He hangs up. He returns to his seat. A moment later he extends his leg to look at his new SHOES now STAINED WITH WINE.

dialogues.speaker: LATER --
dialogues.text: Jack emerges unsteadily from the bowels of the emergency  room, his face purple and swollen beneath the HUGE WHITE  BANDAGE that holds the NOSEGUARD in place. Miles walks wi him toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to need an operation. Maybe  a couple of them. They have to wait  for it it to heal first. Then they  break it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thing you have a voice-over  career.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna fuck that up too. I should sue  her ass. Only reason I won't is to  protect Christine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk by us and out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits in the Saab's passenger side with the seat almo fully reclined. When his agony allows him to open his eye he glares at the DANISH THEMED STORES lining the street. ABELSKIVER MAKER plies his lofty trade in a nearby window He hears a strange CLOMPING NOISE and turns his head to s a MAN IN WOODEN CLOGS walking noisily down the street, dr in a TRADITIONAL DANISH COSTUME and carrying a TUBA. Jack takes a slug of wine. Just then Miles gets back in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles tears open a paper bag and removes a bottle of pill A closer angle reveals them as VICODIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a couple of these, and you'll  learn to love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles opens the bottle and hands Jack two PILLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two for you. And two for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack washes down the pills and passes the bottle to Miles who follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Miles sit across from each other. For the first  time we see LARGE PURPLE BRUISES on Jack's arms and chest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how did Stephanie know it was  Saturday? We didn't get into that  with Gary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Let me think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you didn't say anything to  Maya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I'm sure. And just what are you  implying? I'm really pissed off at  you about all this, if you want to  know the truth. What's Maya going to  think of me now just for associating  with you? You're the one who's  sabotaging me, not the other way  around, pal. Not by a longshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack takes a long lie-detecting look at Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Just seems fishy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys lie on their respective beds staring at the TV.  Jack gets up and lumbers slowly to the dresser MIRROR lik large dog who has just been neutered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it look like to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you were in a bad car  accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns to Miles, nodding and thinking. Then he looks  back in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing. Thursday night is Cajun Wings Night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Jack are finishing their SALADS in the rustic-  themed restaurant festooned with animal trophies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'm thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking it's time to settle  down. One woman. One house. You know.  It's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack nods his head with no self-awareness or acknowledgme of the irony.

dialogues.speaker: NOW TWO PLATES ARRIVE
dialogues.text: mounded high with ribs, slaw, beans and butter-whipped ma potatoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm. Mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their cheery, saftig blonde WAITRESS removes several FOIL PACKETS from her apron and places them on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here're your Handi-wipes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so that's what those are? For a  second there I thought you guys were  promoting safe sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress OVER-LAUGHS and swipes a hand at her naughty customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back with more corn  bread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack watches her go and leans in close to Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you that chick is two tons of  fun. You know, the grateful type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I wouldn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she comes back toward the table carrying a BIG BASKET Beneath the hideous uniform, her nylons SH-SH-SH as she w When she arrives, she replenishes their corn bread basket using big TONGS. Jack watches attentively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice technique there... (checking her name  tag) ...Cammi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all in the wrist. (a moment later) You know, you look really familiar.  You from around here? Where'd you go  to high school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're from San Diego. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You just seem really  familiar to me. Never mind. Enjoy  your meals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on. Did you ever know a Derek  Sommersby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Derek Sommersby? You mean  from "One Life to Live"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles looks away and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to imagine him with a bandage  and shorter hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cammi stares at Jack, her face transforms in astonishm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Way. No way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack smiles and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you tell me where the bathroom  is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her eyes barely  leaving Jack) Uh, sure, it's right over there,  right past the buffalo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles gets up and heads toward the bathroom as Jack's  flirtation with Cammi continues. The camera PANS with Miles as he walks by us and goes thr the bathroom door, which closes behind him, filling the f with the word "MEN."

dialogues.speaker: LATER --
dialogues.text: A TOOTHPICK DISPENSER as a finger tips it forward to disp one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles stands by the cash register and PICKS HIS TEETH as watches Jack finish speaking with Cammi and head his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets off in an hour, so I think  I'm just going to have a drink and  then... make sure she gets home safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're joking, right? (seeing that he isn't) What are you doing? Un-fucking- believeable. Can we just go back to  the hotel and hang out and get up  early and play nine holes before we  head home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack rests one hand on Miles's shoulder and drops his hea thinking how best to put it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Miles. I know you're my friend  and you care about me. And I know  you disapprove. I respect that. But  there are some things I have to do  that you don't understand. You  understand wine and literature and  movies, but you don't understand my  plight. And that's okay.

dialogues.speaker: MILES --
dialogues.text: as the disappointment in his friend deepens by the moment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now comes the sound of hysterical KNOCKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite the knocking, Miles remains motionless in bed, hi expression serene. Finally he awakens and drags himself toward the door, ope it to find --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: silhouetted against the first rosy fingers of dawn. He is barefoot. In fact he is clad only in his UNDERWEAR. Huggi himself, he PANTS and SHIVERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus fucking Christ, it's freezing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He limps past Miles, yanks off the bed covers and wraps t around himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicodin. Where's the Vicodin? My  nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles hands him the bottle, and Jack frantically pops a c of pills, chewing them like candy. He sits down and bends over at the waist as though preparing for an airplane cra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking chick's married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her husband works a night shift or  something, and he comes home, and  I'm on the floor with my cock in his  wife's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Jack. Jesus. And you walked  all the way back from Solvang?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ran. Twisted my ankle too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's five clicks, Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking-a it's five clicks! At one  point I had to cut through an ostrich  farm. Fuckers are mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles has now awakened to take in the absurdity of the wh scene, and he LAUGHS HARD. The blanketed bulge just sits  there. Finally it looks up and shows its pitiful visage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left my wallet. My credit cards,  cash, fucking ID, everything. We  gotta go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big deal. We'll call right now and  cancel your cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. The wedding  bands. The wedding bands are in my  wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so they were in your wallet,  and you left your wallet somewhere.  Some bar. Christine'll understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She ordered them special. Took  her forever to find them. They've  got this design on them with dolphins  and our names engraved in Sanskrit.  We've got to go back. Christine'll  fucking crucify me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pitiful whine) Please, Miles, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. Your wallet was stolen at  a bar. Happens every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stares straight ahead, breathing through his mouth a he considers this. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we've got to get my wallet! Those  rings are irreplaceable! We've got  to get them, Miles! I fucked up! I  know I fucked up, okay? I fucked up.  You gotta help me. You gotta help  me. Pleeeease!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack now descends to a level of wretchedness and desperat that Miles has never seen before in Jack, or in anyone el for that matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, please... Oh God. I know  I'm bad. I know I did a bad thing.  Help me, Miles. Just this one thing,  this one last thing. I can't lose  Christine. I can't. I'm nothing  without her. Please, Miles, please...  uuuuu... uuuuuu.... uuuuuuu......

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No longer able to form words, Jack is reduced to emitting low, primitive sounds. Snot flows from beneath his bandag nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles drives in the early-morning light. Jack is now subd quieted by his pain and exhaustion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tell you she was married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what the fuck were you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't supposed to be back till six.  Fucker rolls in at five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutting it a little close, don't you  think? (off Jack's silence) So how was she? Compared to Stephanie,  say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horny as shit. Flopping around like  a landed trout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab creeps around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack scans the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, this is the block. Just keep  going... (spotting an AMC Pacer) Yeah! This is it. There's her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles pulls over and cuts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plan is... you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ankle. Just go explain the  situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic, clearing  his throat) Uh, excuse me, sir, but my friend  was the one balling your wife a couple  hours ago, and he seems to have left  his wallet behind, and we were  wondering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Like that. Just like  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles gives Jack a withering look. Jack reaches for the D HANDLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. I'll get it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Jack's shirt) Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles crosses the street and approaches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles presses his ear against the front door. Nothing. Th he notices -- A SLIDING GLASS DOOR a few feet away, just barely cracked open. MILES creeps over, sticks his hand into the open space an pulls back the curtain to reveal -- A LIVING ROOM the is hideously MESSY. Draped over a defor beanbag chair are JACK'S LEVI'S. Miles gathers his courage, carefully slides open the glas door, and creeps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A furtive search of Jack's pockets reveals NOTHING. Then  Miles notices a HIGH-PITCHED SOUND wafting from an open d down a short HALLWAY. Miles feverishly begins foraging through the debris on th floor. Again nothing. Meanwhile the noise from the bedroo grows louder -- female MOANING in odd rhythmic unison wit MAN'S VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALLWAY --
dialogues.text: Miles gets on ALL FOURS and starts crawling, weaving his through a trail of shoes and clothes. Nearing the open door, the sounds grow more distinct --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think I fuck you, bitch?  I'll fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a bad girl. I'm a bad girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles peers around the corner of the open door to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cammi is TIED to the faux brass headboard. A BIG GUY slam away at her. In the corner a soundless TV shows a PRESIDE PRESS CONFERENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You picked him up and you fucked  him, didn't you, bitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I picked him up and I fucked him.  I'm a bad girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you liked fucking him, didn't  you, you fat little whore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked it when you caught me fucking  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Miles manages to tear his eyes away from this nature  documentary and scan the room.

dialogues.speaker: IRIS IN --
dialogues.text: to the WALLET atop the dresser. Miles's eyes dart back and forth between the couple and t wallet. His HEART BEATING LOUDLY, he goes for it. He scra to his feet, dashes across the room, seizes the wallet an tears out. Behind him he hears --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wallet! He took Derek's wallet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles comes flying out of the sliding glass door, followe swiftly by the man, who is of course STARK NAKED. And he' fast for a man his size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is reclined in the passenger seat FAST ASLEEP. On th radio NPR'S CARL KASSEL reads the news.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE DRIVER'S WINDOW --
dialogues.text: Miles comes sprinting towards us, mere steps ahead of Cam naked husband. Finding the car door locked, Miles knocks  loudly on the glass, startling Jack awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up! Jesus! Open the goddamn  door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack flips the electric locks just in time for Miles to g in before -- WHUMP! The guy's BELLY hits the window. He pounds on the  roof before trying the door, now re-locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You motherfuckers! I'll kill you!  I'll kill you motherfuckers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles starts the car and begins to drive away. The guy tr to keep up but can't, running barefoot on asphalt. Jack t to look --

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE BACK WINDOW --
dialogues.text: The guy recedes in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: removes the rings from the wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it! You fucking did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They LAUGH and SLAP HANDS.

dialogues.speaker: MILES --
dialogues.text: For all his failures, this time he did something right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shades are drawn. Jack is CRASHED OUT on the bed, sno loudly. Miles folds his shirts and trousers -- readying h bags for departure. At one moment he stops and watches his friend sleep. A KNOCK at the door. Miles goes to answer it, but once hi hand is on the knob, he pauses. If we're perceptive, we w know he's hoping against hope that it's Maya. He opens it. It's just the MAID with her big CART.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Housekeeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab enters the freeway and heads south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles drives while Jack stares out the window, WATCHING T LANDSCAPE CHANGE as they leave wine country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jack. Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hrnrnrn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was quite a day yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's eyes close, but his lips spread into a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Quite a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A driving shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles pumps the gas, while nearby Jack stretches his legs As Miles puts the nozzle back in place --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, why don't you invite Maya to  the wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow I don't think inviting Maya  to your wedding is the right move.  In fact, after your bullshit, it's  going to be hard for me to even go  to the Hitching Post again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so negative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles replaces the hose and screws on the gas cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let me drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. You rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the car makes its way back toward the freeway, Jack lo over at Miles and slows the car to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Buckle up, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles obeys. Without hesitation, Jack accelerates and JUM THE CURB, heading into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab plows INTO A TREE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at his face) You said it looked like a car  accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pay for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get out to inspect the damage. The hood is slightly  crumpled, and the front fender is bent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Doesn't look like  anybody got hurt in this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Oh, Christ. No, you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a new car anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles looks at his friend, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I'd pay for it.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER --
dialogues.text: The trunk is open, and the guys are unloading their cases wine. Miles notices that one box is DRIPPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You broke some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not whatever. You fucking  derelict.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER --
dialogues.text: Miles looks on as Jack hoists a FOUNDATION BLOCK toward t open driver's door of the Saab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles waves his hand in a gesture of "Get it over with." Grunting with effort, Jack leans inside the car and drops the foundation block onto the GAS PEDAL. Direct hit! Jack leaps backward and hits the dirt just in time. Miles and Jack watch the driverless Saab race toward the  tree, its speed increasing. But just before hitting it, t car drifts to one side and SAILS RIGHT PAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car zooms wildly across the vacant lot and, missing t tree, continues on until CRASHING THROUGH A FENCE and fin toppling headlong into a CEMENT TRENCH. Only the back of car remains visible. The whole thing is finished in a matter of seconds. Still frozen in place, Miles and Jack turn slowly to each other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I've got Triple A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From in front of the Saab, we see its now CRUMPLED HOOD a FENDER, a couple of BUNGEE CORDS holding the whole thing  together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab approaches the end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FRONT PORCH --
dialogues.text: Miles has helped Jack carry his bags and the wine. He plo the last case down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. That about does it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. You're on your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'll see you at the rehearsal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They give each other a brief manly back-slappy hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles heads toward the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't pull away till they see  the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder) Yeah. (turning around) Hey, why wasn't I injured?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile) You were wearing your belt.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT HIS CAR --
dialogues.text: Miles gets in and watches through the side window as Mrs. Erganian opens the front door and welcomes Jack with shoc and dismay. Jack points back at -- MILES raising one hand in a feeble wave. The camera slowl MOVES CLOSER as he continues to watch --

dialogues.speaker: JACK --
dialogues.text: weaving his story of woe. He's a great actor when he want to be. Mr. Erganian and a mortified Christine come to the door too. Mr. Erganian takes a few steps toward the car t get a better look.

dialogues.speaker: MILES --
dialogues.text: watching the drama play out. Then his eyes drop as he  momentarily loses himself in melancholy. This reverie is  interrupted by --

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE OF AN ARMENIAN PRIEST
dialogues.text: Startled, Miles turns to look at --

dialogues.speaker: A PRIEST
dialogues.text: who is singing the BLESSING OF THE RINGS. We are now in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The church is packed. CLOSE ON THE RINGS as the priest holds them aloft. If those rings could talk... Jack shoots a quick look at  Miles, who looks right back. The priest continues his  blessing.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TOP OF THE STAIRS --
dialogues.text: The WEDDING FAMILIES greet the exiting guests in a RECEIV LINE. Smiling and exuberant, Jack seems utterly at home a the new groom.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BOTTOM OF THE STEPS --
dialogues.text: Miles watches the scene, not without melancholy. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles turns and looks up to see Victoria, standing one st above him. Just behind her is her NEW HUSBAND. He exudes quiet confidence of a successful businessman who played  college football, takes expensive skiing and sailing  vacations, and hasn't read a novel since high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Vicki. (taking her in) You look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Um, this is Ken Cortland, my  husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From his spot hovering over Miles, Ken leans down and off his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. How you doing? You're a lucky  guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (to Victoria) I'll wait for you at the car. (to Miles) Nice to meet you, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exit Ken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was big of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's good that way. Very  considerate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the last time we spoke? I don't  know. Could be better. Could be worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's happening with your book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Universally rejected. Strike three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Miles. That's awful. What are  you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the drawing board, I guess.  Or not. So... you're married.  Congratulations. You look happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like everyone's getting married.  A year ago it was all divorces. Now  it's all weddings. Cyclical, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then a BLACK LINCOLN NAVIGATOR pulls up alongside th curb. The passenger side window is halfway down, and the  sounds of Adult Contemporary Jazz waft out. Victoria give Ken a little wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shifting gears) Well, let's go have some champagne,  shall we? Toast all the newlyweds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me. I'm not drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You quit drinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hit in the solar  plexus) Oh. Huh. Well... (rallying) Congratulations again, Vicki. That's  wonderful news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going to the car) See you over there, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she gets in the car and cruises away, Miles glances ba at --

dialogues.speaker: THE RECEIVING LINE
dialogues.text: -- where Mike Erganian is introducing Jack to some dear o FRIENDS. Mike throws a loving arm around his new son-in-l and Jack is drawn into Mike's bosom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND-PAINTED SIGN, attached to a STOP SIGH and decorate with balloons, reads: "RECEPTION THIS WAY!" with an arrow pointing RIGHT. One by one, CARS are making a right turn. But when his tu comes, Miles turns LEFT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saab pull up outside. Miles leaves the car idling as sprints inside. Moments later he sprints back to his car, this time carrying SOMETHING.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FAST FOOD PLACE
dialogues.text: His bowtie undone, Miles sits at a booth eating. He washe down a bite by draining the contents of a big wax-coated  soft drink cup. He brings the cup to his lap and refills it from a BOTTLE WINE hidden next to him. As he sets the bottle back down, glimpse the label: 1961 Cheval Blanc. He takes another sip. As the camera MOVES CLOSER, all the complex emotions inspired by the wine ripple across Miles face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The marrow of his bone," I repeated  aimlessly. This at least penetrated  my mind. Phineas had died from the  marrow of his bone flowing down his  blood stream to his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voice belongs to one of Miles's PUPILS reading aloud class. Other students follow along silently from their ow copies of A Separate Peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles sits behind his desk at the front of the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not cry then or ever about  Finny. I did not cry even when I  stood watching him being lowered  into his family's straight-laced  burial ground outside of Boston. I  could not escape a feeling that this  was my own funeral, and you do not  cry in that case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to keep reading the  next chapter, Mr. Raymond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as though coming to) Hrnrnrn? No, we'll pick up there on  Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles enters his tiny apartment. He loosens his tie and p down his satchel. On his way to the kitchen, he presses a button on his  ANSWERING MACHINE. As it plays, he opens the REFRIGERATOR and looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One new message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Miles. It's Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles FREEZES, not wanting to miss a single syllable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your letter. I would have  called you sooner, but I think I've  needed some time to think about  everything that happened and what  you wrote to me. Another reason I  didn't call sooner is that I wanted  to finish your book, which I finally  did last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles's heart pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's really lovely, Miles.  You're so good with words. Who cares  if it's not getting published? There  are so many beautiful and painful  things about it. Did you really go  through all that? It must have been  awfully hard. And the sister character -- Jesus, what a wreck. But I have to  say I was really confused by the  ending. Did the father finally commit  suicide, or what? It's driving me  crazy. And the title.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD --
dialogues.text: We see ourselves taking the BUELLTON EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, it's turned cold and rainy  here lately. But I like winter. So  listen, if you ever do decide to  come up here again, you should let  me know. I would say stop by the  Hitching Post, but to tell you the  truth I'm not sure how much longer  I'm going to be working there. I'm  going to graduate soon so I'll  probably relocate. We'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles climbs the wooden steps and approaches Maya's back  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, like I said, I really loved  your novel. Don't give up, Miles.  Keep writing. You're really good.  Hope you're well. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles takes a breath. Finally he KNOCKS. FADE OUT.
